text.p: Cyphercom Solutions Inc said Wednesday that it was experiencing liquidity difficulties and may have to file for bankruptcy if it is unable to persuade its preferred stockholders to convert their shares into debt or equity.

The company said it was in negotiations with preferred stockholders. If those negotiations were not successful "within the next few days" and additional financing obtained, the company said in a statement that it would have to "cease all operations."
Among the alternatives is filing for bankruptcy and/or the disposition of some or all of its tangible assets, which the company said consist primarily of computers and related equipment.
